typeSystemDescription.name: ArgumentationTypeSystem
typeSystemDescription.description:
Type system for all annotation types related and specific to our research on argumentation.
Extends the AItools Core type system.

typeDescription.name: de.aitools.ie.uima.type.argumentation.PromptAdherence
typeDescription.description: Text-level classification of the prompt adherence of an essay, as defined in (Persing and Ng, ACL 2014).

featureDescription.name: score
featureDescription.description: The prompt adherence score from the scale [1.0, 4.0].

featureDescription.name: fold
featureDescription.description: The number of the fold within the cross-validation of Persing and Ng (where available).

featureDescription.name: errors1
featureDescription.description: List of prompt adherence error types with respect to the first component of the respective prompt. The error types are separated by commas.

featureDescription.name: errors2
featureDescription.description: List of prompt adherence error types with respect to the second component of the respective prompt. The error types are separated by commas.

featureDescription.name: errors3
featureDescription.description: List of prompt adherence error types with respect to the third component of the respective prompt. The error types are separated by commas.

typeDescription.name: de.aitools.ie.uima.type.argumentation.ThesisClarity
typeDescription.description: Text-level classification of the thesis clarity of an essay, as defined in (Persing and Ng, ACL 2013).

featureDescription.name: score
featureDescription.description: The thesis clarity score from the scale [1.0, 4.0].

featureDescription.name: fold
featureDescription.description: The number of the fold within the cross-validation of Persing and Ng (where available).

featureDescription.name: errors
featureDescription.description: List of thesis clarity error types, separated by commas.

typeDescription.name: de.aitools.ie.uima.type.argumentation.Organization
typeDescription.description: Text-level classification of the organization of an essay, as defined in (Persing and Ng, EMNLP 2010).

featureDescription.name: score
featureDescription.description: The organization score from the scale [1.0, 4.0].

featureDescription.name: fold
featureDescription.description: The number of the fold within the cross-validation of Persing and Ng (where available).

featureDescription.name: allScores
featureDescription.description: List of all organization scores assigned to an essay, separated by comma. The reason for this feature is that some essays have been annotated multiple times for (Persing and Ng, 2010). The first of these is the one set as the (main) organization score.

typeDescription.name: de.aitools.ie.uima.type.argumentation.ArgumentStrength
typeDescription.description: Text-level classification of the argument strength of an essay, as defined in (Persing and Ng, ACL 2015).

featureDescription.name: score
featureDescription.description: The argument strength score from the scale [1.0, 4.0].

featureDescription.name: fold
featureDescription.description: The number of the fold within the cross-validation of Persing and Ng (where available).

typeDescription.name: de.aitools.ie.uima.type.argumentation.MetadataICLE
typeDescription.description: The metadata provided for the ICLE corpus files.

featureDescription.name: file
featureDescription.description: The file name.

featureDescription.name: title
featureDescription.description: The title of the essay.

featureDescription.name: tagged
featureDescription.description: Whether tagged ("Yes") or not ("No").

featureDescription.name: textType
featureDescription.description: The text type of the essay. (table column "type" in original corpus)

featureDescription.name: length
featureDescription.description: The length of the essay, counted in words.

featureDescription.name: conditions
featureDescription.description: Whether timed ("Timed") or not ("No Timing"). Maybe other values possible in principle

featureDescription.name: exams
featureDescription.description: Whether exam ("Yes") or not ("No").

featureDescription.name: age
featureDescription.description: The age of the writer of the essay in years.

featureDescription.name: sex
featureDescription.description: The sex of the writer.

featureDescription.name: country
featureDescription.description: The name of the country the writer of the essay comes from.

featureDescription.name: lLanguage
featureDescription.description: Maybe the learned language of the writer?

featureDescription.name: homeLang1
featureDescription.description: The first home language of the writer of the essay.

featureDescription.name: homeLang2
featureDescription.description: The second home language of the writer of the essay.

featureDescription.name: homeLang3
featureDescription.description: The third home language of the writer of the essay.

featureDescription.name: oLang1
featureDescription.description: The first other language of the writer of the essay.

featureDescription.name: oLang2
featureDescription.description: The second other language of the writer of the essay.

featureDescription.name: oLang3
featureDescription.description: The third other language of the writer of the essay.

featureDescription.name: institutionCode
featureDescription.description: The code of the institution where the essay was written. (instit in original ICLE database)

featureDescription.name: institution
featureDescription.description: The name of the institution where the essay was written. (instit2 in original ICLE database)

featureDescription.name: schoolEng
featureDescription.description: Maybe, how many years English was learned at school.

featureDescription.name: uniEng
featureDescription.description: Maybe, how many years English was learned at the university.

featureDescription.name: monthsEng
featureDescription.description: Maybe, how many months English was learned.

featureDescription.name: date
featureDescription.description: The date the essay was written, given in the form "mm/dd/yyyy hh:mm:ss".

featureDescription.name: status
featureDescription.description: Whether complete or incomplete. Maybe, other values are possible in principle.

featureDescription.name: comments
featureDescription.description: Any comment.

featureDescription.name: active
featureDescription.description: Whether active (1) or not (0).

featureDescription.name: interface
featureDescription.description: ??? (always 1 in original corpus)

featureDescription.name: title2
featureDescription.description: Seems to be the same as the title.

typeDescription.name: de.aitools.ie.uima.type.argumentation.SentenceDiscourseFunction
typeDescription.description: The discourse function of a single sentence.

featureDescription.name: label
featureDescription.description: The label that represents the discourse function.

typeDescription.name: de.aitools.ie.uima.type.argumentation.ParagraphDiscourseFunction
typeDescription.description: The discourse function of a single paragraph.

featureDescription.name: label
featureDescription.description: The label that represents the discourse function.

typeDescription.name: de.aitools.ie.uima.type.argumentation.MetadataAAE
typeDescription.description: The metadata provided for the Argument Annotated Essays corpus files.

featureDescription.name: filename
featureDescription.description: The name of the original corpus essay file.

featureDescription.name: source
featureDescription.description: The URL of the source of the essay.

featureDescription.name: topic
featureDescription.description: The topic of the essay

featureDescription.name: twoSided
featureDescription.description: Whether the essay discusses both stances on a topic or only the one one ("myside bias").

typeDescription.name: de.aitools.ie.uima.type.argumentation.MetadataArgQuality
typeDescription.description: The metadata provided for the Dagstuhl 15512 ArgQuality corpus files.

featureDescription.name: perspective
featureDescription.description: The perspective of the argument

featureDescription.name: topic
featureDescription.description: The topic of the argument

typeDescription.name: de.aitools.ie.uima.type.argumentation.ArgumentativeDiscourseUnit
typeDescription.description: A basic unit of an argumentative text. May also cover non-argumenative parts within such a text. The unit may be assigned a certain type.

featureDescription.name: unitType
featureDescription.description: The type of the unit.

typeDescription.name: de.aitools.ie.uima.type.argumentation.ElementaryDiscourseUnit
typeDescription.description: A basic unit of the discourse of a text. The unit may be assigned a certain type.

featureDescription.name: unitType
featureDescription.description: The type of the unit.

typeDescription.name: de.aitools.ie.uima.type.argumentation.Argument
typeDescription.description: An argument, seen here as a relation between an argumentative unit serving as a premise and an argumentative unit serving as a conclusion. The argument may be assigned a certain type. If the represented argument has more than premise in fact, it can be modeled through multiple annotations of this type.

featureDescription.name: premises
featureDescription.description: The premises of the argument

featureDescription.name: conclusion
featureDescription.description: The conclusion of the argument.

featureDescription.name: argumentType
featureDescription.description: The type of the argument.

typeDescription.name: de.aitools.ie.uima.type.argumentation.MetadataWebis16Editorials
typeDescription.description: The metadata of a news editorial from the Webis-16-Editorials corpus.

featureDescription.name: lastUpdate
featureDescription.description: The date of the last update of the news editorial

featureDescription.name: url
featureDescription.description: The URL of the editorial

featureDescription.name: portal
featureDescription.description: The short name of the portal from the which editorial was retrieved.

featureDescription.name: authors
featureDescription.description: The authors of the editorial

featureDescription.name: articleSum
featureDescription.description: The sum of the editorial

featureDescription.name: title
featureDescription.description: The title of the editorial

typeDescription.name: de.aitools.ie.uima.type.argumentation.MetadataNewsQuality
typeDescription.description: The metadata of the news articles from the News Quality dataset published in ACL 2016.

featureDescription.name: id
featureDescription.description: The ID of the news article given in the dataset.

featureDescription.name: name
featureDescription.description: The name of the article given in the dataset

typeDescription.name: de.aitools.ie.uima.type.argumentation.NewsQuality
typeDescription.description: All quality scores assigned to a news article, each in the range from 1 to 5

featureDescription.name: fluency
featureDescription.description: The fluency score

featureDescription.name: conciseness
featureDescription.description: The conciseness score

featureDescription.name: descriptiveness
featureDescription.description: The descriptiveness score

featureDescription.name: novelty
featureDescription.description: The novelty score

featureDescription.name: completeness
featureDescription.description: The completeness score

featureDescription.name: referencing
featureDescription.description: The referencing score

featureDescription.name: formality
featureDescription.description: The formality score

featureDescription.name: richness
featureDescription.description: The richness score

featureDescription.name: attractiveness
featureDescription.description: The attractiveness score

featureDescription.name: technicality
featureDescription.description: The technicality score

featureDescription.name: popularity
featureDescription.description: The popularity score

featureDescription.name: subjectivity
featureDescription.description: The subjectivity score

featureDescription.name: positiveEmotion
featureDescription.description: The positive emotion score

featureDescription.name: negativeEmotion
featureDescription.description: The negative emotion score

featureDescription.name: quality
featureDescription.description: The overall quality score

featureDescription.name: confidence
featureDescription.description: The confidence score of the annotator

featureDescription.name: sentimentality
featureDescription.description: The sentimentality score. Computed as = abs(positiveEmotion) + abs(negativeEmotion) - 2 (which the authors clarified after asking them).

featureDescription.name: polarity
featureDescription.description: The polarity score. Computed as = positiveEmotion - negativeEmotion (which the authors clarified after asking them).

typeDescription.name: de.aitools.ie.uima.type.argumentation.NewsSentiment
typeDescription.description: The sentence sentiment annotations given in the dataset.

featureDescription.name: subjectivity
featureDescription.description: The subjectivity score

featureDescription.name: positivity
featureDescription.description: The positivity score

featureDescription.name: negativity
featureDescription.description: The negativity score

featureDescription.name: issue
featureDescription.description: The issue flag, "I" for ignore sentence and "S" for sentence splitting issue.

featureDescription.name: confidence
featureDescription.description: The confidence score of the annotator

featureDescription.name: polarity
featureDescription.description:
The polaritv value from {positive, neutral, negative}. This value is not in the original news quality corpus, but it is derived as follows:
If positivity (negativity) is above 0 and negativity (positivity) is 0, then the polarity is positive (negative). Else, it is neutral.

typeDescription.name: de.aitools.ie.uima.type.argumentation.ArgumentativeZone
typeDescription.description: The argumentative zone annotation type

featureDescription.name: zone
featureDescription.description: The zone type

typeDescription.name: de.aitools.ie.uima.type.argumentation.MetadataAraucaria
typeDescription.description: The metadata provided for the Araucaria corpus files.

featureDescription.name: author
featureDescription.description: The name of the author.

featureDescription.name: date
featureDescription.description: The date the text was created (annotated).

featureDescription.name: source
featureDescription.description: Description of the source the text was taken from.

featureDescription.name: comments
featureDescription.description: Comments

typeDescription.name: de.aitools.ie.uima.type.argumentation.MetadataArgMicrotext
typeDescription.description: The metadata provided for the Arg-Microtext corpus files.

featureDescription.name: textID
featureDescription.description: The ID of the text.

featureDescription.name: topicID
featureDescription.description: The ID (short name) of the topic.

featureDescription.name: stance
featureDescription.description: The stance of the text.

typeDescription.name: de.aitools.ie.uima.type.argumentation.MetadataUGWD
typeDescription.description: The metadata of the texts in the user-generated web discourse corpus.

featureDescription.name: author
featureDescription.description: The name of the author

featureDescription.name: docType
featureDescription.description: The document type

featureDescription.name: origURL
featureDescription.description: The original URL

featureDescription.name: topic
featureDescription.description: The topic

featureDescription.name: title
featureDescription.description: The title

featureDescription.name: thumbsUp
featureDescription.description: The number of thumbs-up votes

featureDescription.name: thumbsDown
featureDescription.description: The number of thumbs-down votes

featureDescription.name: origID
featureDescription.description: The original ID

featureDescription.name: note
featureDescription.description: Notes

featureDescription.name: date
featureDescription.description: The date

typeDescription.name: de.aitools.ie.uima.type.argumentation.Cogency
typeDescription.description: The cogency quality assessment of an argument or argumentation.

featureDescription.name: majority
featureDescription.description: The majority score over all annotators.

featureDescription.name: mean
featureDescription.description: The mean score over all annotators.

featureDescription.name: allScores
featureDescription.description: The list of scores of all annators

featureDescription.name: mean

featureDescription.name: allScores
